senses.de: to take and use something that belongs to someone else, and return it to them after a period of time

Tips.title: Temporary Use
Tips.description: Borrowing implies you'll return the item after temporary use without payment.
Tips.example: I need to borrow your bike for my morning ride.

Tips.title: Implied Trust
Tips.description: Borrowing involves trust between the lender and the borrower.
Tips.example: She trusts me enough to borrow her laptop.

Tips.title: Recipient Initiative
Tips.description: The borrower is usually the one who initiates the action of borrowing.
Tips.example: Can I borrow your textbook for my revision?

senses.de: to take and use words, ideas, or money from another source
senses.ex: She is suspected of borrowing her thesis from another student's work.

Tips.title: Originality Questioned
Tips.description: Using someone's ideas can imply a lack of originality or authenticity.
Tips.example: She was criticized for borrowing his designs for her project.

Tips.title: Cite Appropriately
Tips.description: When borrowing ideas, proper citation is important to avoid plagiarism.
Tips.example: In my paper, I borrowed theories from different philosophers and cited them.

senses.de: to temporarily transfer control of a system resource to a program
senses.ex: The program borrows processor time from the operating system.

Tips.title: Technical Sharing
Tips.description: In computing, borrow implies resources are used by multiple parties efficiently.
Tips.example: The system borrows memory during peak processing times.

senses.de: to take money from a person or bank and agree to pay it back to them at a later time
senses.ex: The country has had to borrow heavily from abroad to pay for its development program.

Tips.title: Repayment Obligation
Tips.description: Borrowing money comes with a responsibility to repay, often with interest.
Tips.example: We borrowed from the bank to buy a house.

Tips.title: Financial Planning
Tips.description: When borrowing money, consider your ability to repay to avoid debt traps.
Tips.example: They thoughtfully calculated before deciding to borrow for their startup.

senses.de: to adopt (a word or phrase) from a foreign language
senses.ex: English has borrowed many words from Latin.

Tips.title: Language Evolution
Tips.description: Languages borrow from each other, adding richness and diversity to vocabulary.
Tips.example: 'Café' is a term borrowed from French.

Tips.title: Cultural Exchange
Tips.description: Word borrowing shows cultural interaction and exchange throughout history.
Tips.example: English borrowed 'yoga' from Sanskrit, reflecting cultural influence.

senses.de: to take a unit from the next column to the left in subtracting figures
senses.ex: When subtracting 9 from 7, you need to borrow 1 from the tens place.

Tips.title: Math Operation
Tips.description: In subtraction, borrowing means taking a value to help subtract a larger number.
Tips.example: To subtract 8 from 3, borrow 1 from the adjacent tens column.

Lend.wordDefinition:
To lend means to give something to someone with the expectation that it will be returned. For example, a library lends books to patrons, or a friend might lend you their pencil if you don't have one.

So, one key difference between the two words is that borrow refers to taking something, while lend refers to giving something.

Another difference is that when you borrow something, you are the one doing the taking, while when you lend something, you are the one doing the giving.

Overall, knowing when to use borrow versus lend is about understanding who is doing the taking and who is doing the giving.

If you are taking something, you would say borrow, and if you are giving something, you would say "lend."

Obtain.wordDefinition:
Obtain means to get or acquire something through various means such as purchase or negotiation. For example, if you go to a store to buy a book, you would be obtaining it by paying for it.

The difference between the two words is that borrowing means taking something temporarily with the intention of returning it, while obtaining means getting something permanently or for the long-term.

Borrowing is applicable in situations where you need something temporarily, while obtaining is applicable in situations where you need something for a longer period of time or permanently.

quotes.Text: My parents had no money, but they had strong values that I've carried throughout my life - things like not going into debt, never borrowing money, never leveraging, paying your bills on time, keeping your agreements, selling customers the right things, treating employees right, and growing things.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Jack Dangermond

quotes.Text: All my songs usually borrow from my own life but pull from fantasy or other people's stories that you hear, or something you read. It's fun as a writer to pull from all those different places, and to connect them. But also, I don't have an interesting enough life to strictly pull from that.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Samuel Ervin Beam

quotes.Text: In my books I might hold the mirror to my own face. If others would like to borrow the mirror, they're welcome. The books aren't there to accuse others - merely to raise issues and keep the debates alive.
quotes.Name: John Scott

quotes.Text: I'm concerned a little bit with the culture of celebrating the fundraise. My dad taught me that when you borrow money it's the worst day of your life.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Gary Vaynerchuk

quotes.Text: I went to the bank and asked to borrow a cup of money. They said, 'What for?' I said, 'I'm going to buy some sugar.
quotes.Title: American Comedian
quotes.Name: Steven Wright

quotes.Text: Home life ceases to be free and beautiful as soon as it is founded on borrowing and debt.
quotes.Title: Norwegian Poet
quotes.Name: Henrik Ibsen

quotes.Text: I have only ever borrowed money for investment. I have been sound money all my life.
quotes.Title: English Politician
quotes.Name: Ken Livingstone

quotes.Text: Any self-respecting entrepreneur has borrowed money from their mother at some point.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Kevin Plank

quotes.Text: Worry is the interest paid by those who borrow trouble.
quotes.Title: American President
quotes.Name: George Washington
